dk.jakobhandersen.multiregionexporterforcubase

Class ExporterEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • dk.jakobhandersen.multiregionexporterforcubase.ExporterEngine

  • public class ExporterEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    The class that coordinates the actual functionality of the application. Handles connectivity with the UserInterface.
    Author:
    Jakob Hougaard Andersen

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.List<AudioBite> audioBites
      AudioBites that are properly set up and lie within the length of the loaded audio file

      The amount of seconds the AudioBites are allowed to be outside audio file range.
      private boolean convertToMp3
      Should the output files be converted to mp3 after splitting?

      If converting to mp3, this is the FFMPEG argument controlling bitrate

      Reference to the currently running WaveformGenerator, if any

      Path to FFMPEG program on the user's computer

      The folder in which the output files will be created
      private boolean outputFolderSet
      Has the output folder been set?
      private int renamedAudioBitesInLastXML
      The number of audio bites that were renamed, due to name equality, in the last read XML This is used to give feedback to the user and is only relevant if useCubaseNames == true

      Path to soxi shortcut on the user's computer

      path to temporary folder

      Should the names/descriptions of the individual events in Cubase be used for naming the output audio files.

      reference to the UserInterface, set in constructor

      private int waveformWidth
      Number of horizontal pixels

    • Field Detail

      • currentInputAudioFile

        InputAudioFile currentInputAudioFile
        The currently read audio file (represented as an InputAudioFile) if any

      • audioBites

        private java.util.List<AudioBite> audioBites
        AudioBites that are properly set up and lie within the length of the loaded audio file

      • biteOutsideAudioTolerance

        private double biteOutsideAudioTolerance
        The amount of seconds the AudioBites are allowed to be outside audio file range. To compensate for small rounding errors and alike.

      • trailingTime

        private double trailingTime
        The time in seconds that is added to the length of the individual AudioBite. This can be useful if the mix has reverb or other time influencing effects.

      • outputFolder

        private java.lang.String outputFolder
        The folder in which the output files will be created

      • outputFolderSet

        private boolean outputFolderSet
        Has the output folder been set?

      • useCubaseNames

        private boolean useCubaseNames
        Should the names/descriptions of the individual events in Cubase be used for naming the output audio files. Alternatively, a fixed name (fixedName) specified by the user will be used as names (followed by _0001, _0002, 000n)

      • renamedAudioBitesInLastXML

        private int renamedAudioBitesInLastXML
        The number of audio bites that were renamed, due to name equality, in the last read XML This is used to give feedback to the user and is only relevant if useCubaseNames == true

      • fixedName

        private java.lang.String fixedName
        If useCubaseNames == false, this string will be used for naming the output audio files

      • soxPath

        private java.lang.String soxPath
        Path to sox program on the user's computer

      • soxiPath

        private java.lang.String soxiPath
        Path to soxi shortcut on the user's computer

      • ffmpegPath

        private java.lang.String ffmpegPath
        Path to FFMPEG program on the user's computer

      • currentlyRunningSplitter

        private AudioOutputter currentlyRunningSplitter
        Reference to the currently running AudioSplitter, if any

      • currentlyRunningWaveformGenerator

        private WaveformGenerator currentlyRunningWaveformGenerator
        Reference to the currently running WaveformGenerator, if any

      • currentlyRunningInputAudioFileBuilder

        private InputAudioFileBuilder currentlyRunningInputAudioFileBuilder
        Reference to the currently running InputAudioFileBuilder, if any

      • waveformWidth

        private int waveformWidth
        Number of horizontal pixels

      • waveformHeight

        private int waveformHeight
        Number of vertical pixels

      • convertToMp3

        private boolean convertToMp3
        Should the output files be converted to mp3 after splitting?

      • convertToMp3FFMPEGBitrateArgument

        private java.lang.String convertToMp3FFMPEGBitrateArgument
        If converting to mp3, this is the FFMPEG argument controlling bitrate

      • startedProcesses

        private java.util.List<java.lang.Process> startedProcesses
        List of currently started Processes that need to be destroyed if the application is closed.

      • userInterface

        private UserInterface userInterface
        reference to the UserInterface, set in constructor

      • temporaryFolderPath

        private java.lang.String temporaryFolderPath
        path to temporary folder

    • Method Detail

      • audioOutputterDoneCallback

        public void audioOutputterDoneCallback(int successes,
                                       int total,
                                       AudioOutputter caller)
        Called from the AudioOutputter when this is done
        Parameters:
        successes - the number of successfully created files
        total - the number of the files that were supposed to be created
        caller - the AudioSplitter calling this function

      • audioOutputterPercentageCallback

        public void audioOutputterPercentageCallback(int percentage)
        Called from AudioOutputter to inform user about progress of output process
        Parameters:
        percentage - percentage done (0 to 100)

      • audioOutputterProcessTextCallback

        public void audioOutputterProcessTextCallback(java.lang.String text)
        Called from AudioOutputter to inform user about progress of output process
        Parameters:
        text - what is the outputter doing now?

      • cleanUp

        public void cleanUp()
        Method to be called when closing the application. Interrupts running threads an destroys registered running processes and deletes temporary files

      • createFilesOverwriteAccepted

        public void createFilesOverwriteAccepted()
        Called from the UserInterface when the user accepts overwriting existing files

      • inputAudioFileBuilderCallback

        public void inputAudioFileBuilderCallback(InputAudioFileBuilder caller,
                                          InputAudioFile builtFile)
        Function called by InputAudioFileBuilder when it is done building the InputAudioFile
        Parameters:
        caller - the InputAudioFileBuilder calling this function
        builtFile - the built InputAudioFile

      • readInputAudioFile

        public void readInputAudioFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Creates a new InputAudioFileBuilder and makes it create a new InputAudioFile as a representation of the specified audio file. The InputAudioFileBuilder later calls InputAudioFileBuilderCallback() when it is done building the InputAudioFile
        Parameters:
        fileName - full path to an audio file

      • readXML

        public void readXML(java.lang.String file)
        Reads a Cubase track file (XML) and parses the content. Calls processAudioBitesFromParser() if the file was successfully parsed
        Parameters:
        file - full path to the XML file to be read

      • registerStartedProcess

        public void registerStartedProcess(java.lang.Process p)
        Method for registering a running Process that needs to be stopped if program is closed before it is done.
        Parameters:
        p - Process to register

      • sendMessageToUser

        public void sendMessageToUser(UserMessageType type,
                              java.lang.String message)
        Sends a message to the user. Printed in the Log window.
        Parameters:
        type - type of message - determines how it is shown.
        message - the actual message

      • setConvertToMp3

        public void setConvertToMp3(boolean convert)
        Called from UserInterface when convert to mp3 is changed/set
        Parameters:
        convert -

      • setMp3ConversionBitrateArgument

        public void setMp3ConversionBitrateArgument(java.lang.String argument)
        Called from UserInterface when mp3 conversion settings are changed/set
        Parameters:
        argument - bitrate argument used in FFMPEG for mp3 conversion

      • setOutputFolder

        public void setOutputFolder(java.lang.String path)
        Sets the output folder and at the same time starts the output process.
        Parameters:
        path - path to the folder in which the output file should be written

      • setTrailingTime

        public void setTrailingTime(double seconds)
        Sets the amount of time (seconds) that each AudioBite is extended in length compared to the actual event/region in Cubase
        Parameters:
        seconds -

      • setWaveformHeight

        public void setWaveformHeight(int height)
        Sets the height in pixels of waveform view
        Parameters:
        height -

      • setWaveformWidth

        public void setWaveformWidth(int width)
        Sets the width in pixels of waveform view
        Parameters:
        width -

      • unregisterStartedProcess

        public void unregisterStartedProcess(java.lang.Process p)
        Method for unregistering a Process previously registered as running.
        Parameters:
        p - Process to unregister

      • useCubaseNames

        public void useCubaseNames()
        Called from UserInterface if the user wants to use output audio file naming based on event names/descriptions in Cubase (in track XML file)

      • useFixedName

        public void useFixedName(java.lang.String n)
        Called from UserInterface if the user wants to use a fixed string for naming output audio files
        Parameters:
        n - the name to be used (will be followed by "_0001", "_0002" etc)

      • waveformGeneratorCallback

        public void waveformGeneratorCallback(WaveformGenerator caller,
                                      boolean success,
                                      InputAudioFile inputAudioFile,
                                      java.lang.String waveformPng)
        Called by WaveformGenerator when it is done generating
        Parameters:
        caller - the calling WaveformGenerator
        success - was it successful?
        inputAudioFile - the InputAudioFile the waveform was created on the basis of (might not be the same as currentInputAudioFile).

      • clearAudioBites

        private void clearAudioBites()
        Clears audioBites, removes range markers in the UserInterface and tells it that we are not ready for splitting

      • clearCurrentAudioFile

        private void clearCurrentAudioFile()
        Sets currentInputAudioFile to null and sends relevant messages to the UserInterface

      • clearOutputFolder

        private void clearOutputFolder()
        Clears the path to output folder. To avoid writing to previously specified folder.

      • createFiles

        private void createFiles()
        Creates the files by starting a new AudioSplitter

      • createWaveform

        private void createWaveform()
        Creates a downsampled version of the current input audio file to be used for extracting waveform data.

      • deleteRangeMarkers

        private void deleteRangeMarkers()
        Deletes range markers in the UserInterface

      • outputFolderContainsFilesAlready

        private boolean[] outputFolderContainsFilesAlready()
        Checks if the chosen output folder contains any files with the same name as any of the audio files to be written.
        Returns:
        boolean[2]. First boolean indicates whether output folder contains file(s) to be overwritten. The second boolean indicates whether it is the special case where input audio file will be overwritten.

      • processAudioBitesFromParser

        private void processAudioBitesFromParser(java.util.List<AudioBite> bites,
                                         java.lang.String xmlFileName)
        Takes over from readXML() and does further work with the AudioBites found in the XML file.
        Parameters:
        bites - List of the AudioBites found in Cubase track XML file
        xmlFileName - file name of the Cubase track XML file. Used for user messages.

      • sendEventToInterface

        private void sendEventToInterface(EngineEvent e)

      • setFunctionalEndAndOutputRangeMarkers

        private void setFunctionalEndAndOutputRangeMarkers()
        Sets the functional ends (taking the trailingTime into account) of the AudioBites and also updates the range markers in the UserInterface

      • setPaths

        private void setPaths()
        Set up the different paths. Calculated from paths relative to jar file.

      • ValidateAudioBiteNames

        private int ValidateAudioBiteNames()
        Validates naming of AudioBites (two files can't share same name)
        Returns:
        number of bites that were renamed
